joy.text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
joy.author: Dalai Lama

joy.text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters.
joy.author: Audrey Hepburn

joy.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
joy.author: Mahatma Gandhi

joy.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
joy.author: Dalai Lama

joy.text: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement.
joy.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

joy.text: The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.
joy.author: Thucydides

sadness.text: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
sadness.author: Victor Hugo

sadness.text: There are moments when I wish I could roll back the clock and take all the sadness away.
sadness.author: Yann Martel

sadness.text: The way sadness works is one of the strange riddles of the world.
sadness.author: Emily Dickinson

sadness.text: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
sadness.author: Jean de La Fontaine

sadness.text: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
sadness.author: Leonardo da Vinci

sadness.text: Behind every sweet smile, there is a bitter sadness that no one can see and feel.
sadness.author: Anonymous

fear.text: Fear is only as deep as the mind allows.
fear.author: Japanese Proverb

fear.text: Everything you want is on the other side of fear.
fear.author: Jack Canfield

fear.text: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty.
fear.author: Bertrand Russell

fear.text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
fear.author: Nelson Mandela

fear.text: Do the thing you fear and the death of fear is certain.
fear.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

fear.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
fear.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

anger.text: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
anger.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

anger.text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
anger.author: Mark Twain

anger.text: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
anger.author: Ambrose Bierce

anger.text: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
anger.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

anger.text: When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
anger.author: Thomas Jefferson

anger.text: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more harmful to us than the injury that provokes it.
anger.author: Seneca

disgust.text: The greatest pleasures are only narrowly separated from disgust.
disgust.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

disgust.text: Moral disgust is the result of a psychological immune system.
disgust.author: Jonathan Haidt

disgust.text: Disgust is often described as the most visceral of all basic emotions.
disgust.author: Paul Rozin

disgust.text: The emotion of disgust has evolved as a response to offensive foods that may be harmful.
disgust.author: Charles Darwin

disgust.text: Disgust is one of the basic emotions of our brain necessary for survival.
disgust.author: Antonio Damasio

disgust.text: Disgust and contempt are the primary emotions of moral disapproval.
disgust.author: Macalester Bell

surprise.text: The moments of happiness we enjoy take us by surprise.
surprise.author: Ashley Montagu

surprise.text: Surprise is the greatest gift which life can grant us.
surprise.author: Boris Pasternak

surprise.text: Life is full of surprises and serendipity.
surprise.author: Marissa Mayer

surprise.text: The secret of life is to expect the unexpected.
surprise.author: Oscar Wilde

surprise.text: Each day holds a surprise. But only if we expect it can we see, hear, or feel it.
surprise.author: Henry Moore

surprise.text: Surprise is the spice of life.
surprise.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

anticipation.text: The pleasure isn't in doing the thing, the pleasure is in planning it.
anticipation.author: John Green

anticipation.text: Anticipation makes the heart grow fonder.
anticipation.author: Anonymous

anticipation.text: The idea of waiting for something makes it more exciting.
anticipation.author: Andy Warhol

anticipation.text: Anticipation is the heart of wisdom.
anticipation.author: Alan Watts

anticipation.text: The best things in life are often waiting for you at the exit ramp of your comfort zone.
anticipation.author: Karen Salmansohn

anticipation.text: Anticipation is the electricity of life.
anticipation.author: Willa Cather

trust.text: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication.
trust.author: Stephen Covey

trust.text: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
trust.author: Ernest Hemingway

trust.text: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
trust.author: Benjamin Spock

trust.text: To be trusted is a greater compliment than being loved.
trust.author: George MacDonald

love.text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
love.author: Aristotle

love.text: Where there is love there is life.
love.author: Mahatma Gandhi

love.text: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved.
love.author: Victor Hugo

love.text: Love is a force more formidable than any other.
love.author: Barbara de Angelis

love.text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
love.author: Lao Tzu

love.text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
love.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

optimism.text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.
optimism.author: Helen Keller

optimism.text: Optimism is the one quality more associated with success and happiness than any other.
optimism.author: Brian Tracy

optimism.text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
optimism.author: Colin Powell

optimism.text: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and true progress.
optimism.author: Nicholas M. Butler

optimism.text: Optimism is the most important human trait, because it allows us to evolve our ideas, to improve our situation, and to hope for a better tomorrow.
optimism.author: Seth Godin

optimism.text: Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.
optimism.author: Dalai Lama

anxiety.text: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you.
anxiety.author: Anaïs Nin

anxiety.text: Anxiety's like a rocking chair. It gives you something to do, but it doesn't get you very far.
anxiety.author: Jodi Picoult

anxiety.text: You don't have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
anxiety.author: Dan Millman

anxiety.text: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
anxiety.author: Søren Kierkegaard

anxiety.text: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
anxiety.author: Deepak Chopra

anxiety.text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
anxiety.author: Walter Anderson
